case_vignette: A 14-month-old girl is brought to the pediatrician after her parents noticed her being increasingly irritable with frequent vomiting for the past 2 weeks. Parents deny any history of fever. They recently immigrated to the country and, unfortunately, the mother did not receive prenatal care during pregnancy due to a lack of health insurance. Physical examination is unremarkable except for a head circumference over 2 standard deviations larger than the mean for her age, and delay in meeting motor developmental milestones. A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of her brain shows an enlargement of the posterior fossa, cystic dilation of the 4th ventricle, and hypoplasia of the cerebellar vermis (see image).
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I've been feeling really fussy and keep throwing up a lot for the past 2 weeks.
Have you had any fever or abdominal pain?
No, I haven't had any fever.
Have you been taking any medications recently?
No, I haven't been taking any medications.

No, there haven't been any changes in my diet or eating habits.

Yes, we recently moved to this country.

No, I haven't been around anyone who's been sick.

My parents didn't mention any allergies or past medical conditions.

My parents didn't say anything about changes in my sleep or routine.

My parents didn't mention any changes in my weight or appetite.

I've been having trouble meeting my movement milestones for my age.

My parents didn't mention any changes in my hearing or vision.
Have you had any recent changes in your skin or nails?
My parents didn't mention any changes in my skin or nails.
Have you had any recent changes in your urine or stool?
My parents didn't mention any changes in my urine or stool.

My parents haven't mentioned any problems with my breathing or coughing.
Have you had any recent changes in your energy levels or mood?

The patient has also been having trouble meeting movement milestones for their age and there have been no changes in hearing, vision, skin, nails, urine, stool, breathing, or coughing.
